#Text=AFTER THE CASH

#Text=Tom 's proposal as a way out of the difficulty , and the prompt seconding of it by Mr. Damon , seemed to deprive the other bank officials , Mr. Swift included , of the power of speech for a few moments .
#Text=Then , as there came to the room where the scene had taken place , the sound of the mob outside , clamoring for cash , Mr. Pendergast , the president , remarked in a low voice :
#Text=" It seems to be the only way .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I 'm sure of it , as far as my electric car is concerned , " replied the young inventor .

column1: #Text=" If we get the cash I 'll have it back here on time .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Then do n't lose any time , Tom , " advised his father .

column1: #Text=" Every minute counts . "
#Text=" Yes , " added Mr. Damon .
#Text=" Come on .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The eccentric character caught up his valise , and started from the room .

#Text=Tom followed .

#Text= Now , my son , be careful , " advised his father .

column1: #Text=" You know the need of haste , but do n't take unnecessary risks .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Just imagine you 're racing for that three-thousand-dollar prize , offered by the Touring Club of America , Tom ,  observed Mr. Damon , as he deposited the valise at his feet .

column1: #Text=" I 'm trying for a bigger prize than that .
#Text=The young inventor looked , and saw Andy and his father on the steps of the new institution .
#Text=At the sight of the electric car , speeding along , Andy turned and spoke to his parent .
#Text=What he said seemed to impress Mr. Foger , for he started , and looked more intently at Tom and Mr. Damon .
#Text=Then , as Tom watched , he saw the two excitedly conversing , and a moment later Andy ran off in the direction in which Sam Snedecker and Pete Bailey lived .
#Text=" I wonder if he 's up to any tricks ? " thought Tom , as he turned on more power .
#Text=" Well , if he is , I 'll soon be where he ca n't reach me . "
#Text=The young inventor did not dare send his car at full speed through the streets of the town , and it was not until several minutes had passed that they could go at more than the ordinary rate .
#Text=But once the open country was reached Tom " opened her up full , " and the song the motor sung was one of power .
#Text=The vehicle quickly gathered headway and was soon fairly whizzing along .
#Text=" If we keep this up we 'll be there and back in good time , " remarked Mr. Damon .
#Text=" Yes , but we ca n't do it , " replied his companion .
#Text=" The road to Clayton is a poor one , and we 'll soon be on it .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I know it , " answered Tom , " and I 'm going to count every minute . "

column1: #Text=With eager eyes he watched every inch of the road , to steer to the best advantage .

#Text=His hands gripped the wheel until his knuckles showed white with the strain , and , every now and then his right hand adjusted the speed lever or the controller handle , while his foot was on the emergency brake , ready to stop the car at the first sign of danger .
#Text=And there was danger , not infrequently , for the road was up and down hill , over frail bridges , and along steep cliffs .
#Text=It was no pleasure tour they were on .
#Text=When a little over half the distance had been made they came to a better road , and Tom was able to use full speed ahead .
#Text=Then the electric went so fast that , had it not been for the steel wind-shield in front , Mr. Damon , at any rate , would have been short of breath .
#Text=" This is going some ! " he cried to Tom .
#Text=The lad nodded grimly , and shoved the controller handle over to the last notch .
#Text=Then came a bad stretch and they had to slow down again .
#Text=As they were about out of it there came a little flash of fire and the motor stopped .
